JavaScript (3) - Simple JavaScript Workaround

December 6, 2018

Live Clock appears when button clicked 
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>lab1</title>
    <meta charset='utf-8'>
  </head>
  <script>
    function add(digit) {
      if (digit < 10){
        digit = "0" + digit
      }
      return digit;
    }
    function time() {
      var span=document.getElementById("print");
      setInterval(function(){
        var date=new Date();
        var h = add(date.getHours());
        var m = add(date.getMinutes());
        var s = add(date.getSeconds());
        var ms = (date.getMilliseconds()/100).toFixed(0);
        span.innerText=h+":"+m+":"+s+"."+ms;
      }, 100);
    }
  </script>
  <style>
    body {
      background-color: black;
    }
    button {
      color: red;
      background-color:black;
      border:0;
      font-size: 100px;
      font-family:cursive;
    }
    #container {
      text-align:center;
      color:white;
    }
    #print {
      font-size:150px;
      font-family: fantasy;
    }
  </style>
  <body>
    <div id='container'>
      <button onClick="time()">What time is it?</button>
      <h1 id="print">
      </h1>
    </div>
  </body>
</html>

Click here for demo

Image will move inside the box depends on the user input of speec 
<!DOCTYPE html>
</html>
  <head>
    <title>Bouncing Logo</title>
  </head>
  <style>
    div.bound {
      display:block;
      border-style:solid;
      width:502px;
      height:402px;
      border-width:1px;
    }
    div.move {
      position:absolute;
    }
    input.main{
      padding: 10px 24px;
      border-radius: 12px;
      width: 100px;
      color: black;
      background-color: #bddfeb;
      font-weight: bold;
      text-align: center;
      border-color: #bddfeb;
      border-collapse:
       -webkit-transition-duration: 0.4s; /* Safari */
      transition-duration: 0.4s;
      text-align:center;
    }
    #button{
      padding-left: 402px;
    }
  </style>
  <script>
    var x=0;
    var y=0;
    var max_x=400;
    var max_y=300;
    var xoffset=10;
    var yoffset=10;

    function go(){
      var speed = prompt("1:Faster; 2:Normal; 3:Slower; 4:INSANE MODE");
      if (speed==1){
        speed = 50;
      }
      else if(speed==2){
        speed = 100;
      }
      else if(speed==3){
        speed=200;
      }
      else if(speed==4){
        speed=1;
      }
      else{
        alert("Pick a number between 1 and 3. Speed set to Default");
        speed=200;
      }
      moveCSLogo(speed);
    }
    function moveCSLogo(speed){
      x+=xoffset;
      y+=yoffset;
      document.getElementById("msucs").style.top = y+'px';
      document.getElementById("msucs").style.left = x+'px';
      if ((x+xoffset > max_x) || (x+xoffset < 0))
        xoffset *=-1;
      if ((y+yoffset > max_y) || (y+yoffset < 0))
        yoffset *=-1;
      //window.setTimeout('moveCSLogo()', option);
      window.setTimeout('moveCSLogo('+speed+')',speed);

    }
  </script>
  <body onload="go()">
    <div class="bound">
      <div id="msucs" class="move">
        <img src="mario.png" width="102px" height="102px" alt="need image here" />
      </div>
    </div>
    <p></p>
    <div id="button">
      <form action="lab2.html" method="post">
      	<input type="submit" value="RELOAD!" class ="main">
      </form>
    </div>
  </body>
</html>
Given sentence will move around and change its color when user click on it 
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Lab3</title>
  </head>
  <script>
    function getColor() {
      var letters ='0123456789abcdef';
      var color='#';
      for (var i=0;i<6;i++){
        color = color + letters[Math.round(Math.random()*16)];
      }
      return color;
    }
    function getRand() {
      var number = String(Math.round(Math.random()*500));
      number = number + '';
      return number;
    }
    function change() {
      var span = document.getElementById('changeColor');
      span.style.color=getColor();
      span.style.padding = getRand()+'px';
    }
  </script>
  <body>
    <h1 onClick="change()" id="changeColor">Welcome to CSIT: Click me to change color.</h1>
  </body>
</html>
